[[Image:Riksteatern1960.jpg|thumb|right|150px|[[Playbill]] for the production of ''[[Man and Superman]]'' by [[George Bernard Shaw]], Riksteatern, 1960]] [[Image:RiksteaternMyFairLady.jpg|thumb|right|150px|A 1959 Riksteatern playbill for a production of ''[[My Fair Lady]]'']] '''Riksteatern''' is the name of the popular ''"National Touring Theatre"/"National Theatre Company"'' (~Eng. transl.) in [[Sweden]]. It's the biggest theatre company on tour in Sweden and can, in one way, almost be described as Sweden's national stage on tour.
Riksteatern is financed and owned by 240 local economic associations throughout Sweden and the goal is to promote and produce quality theatre for all of Sweden, outside the city regions.
Riksteatern was established in 1933 and has been on-tour all over Sweden since. The [[Royal Dramatic Theatre]] (the national stage) and the [[Cullberg Ballet]], for example, tours regularly with Riksteatern with many of their most popular productions.
==History of Riksteatern== Riksteatern (or "the Riksteater") was established in 1933 by [[Arthur Engberg]]. ''"Not only the citizens of the capital city in Sweden should be granted the privilege of first class theatre productions. The rest of the nation also has the right to claim this!"'' - with these words, after a long public debate, Riksteatern was given the proper state funding and support. At first Riksteatern, in the 1930s, was supposed to be the touring section of Sweden's [[Royal Dramatic Theatre]], in an effort to reach an audience in Sweden that couldn't get the chance to visit the national stage in [[Stockholm]]. However, in the 1940s Riksteatern was given their own ensemble, producing stage productions solely for Riksteatern and with the purpose to be given on-tour.
In 1966 Riksteatern was corporatized with Sweden's second influential touring theatre organization Svenska Teatern and became "Svenska Riksteatern". In 1967 Riksteatern started a section for producing theatre productions for children and youth, called ''Unga Riks'' ("Young Riksteatern") which has performed quality theatre for children for three decades, performing in schools all over Sweden at low cost on a regular bases.
Since 1977 the theatre group Tyst Teater ("Silent Theatre") is also part of Riksteatern. It's a unique group that specialize in staging theatre productions for deaf in the [[sign language]] and has become very popular and sought after internationally in recent years.
In 1999 "Riks Drama" was founded by [[Lars Norén]], Sweden's leading contemporary playwright today, and also the section of "Riks Gästspel" for guest performances by Riksteatern abroad.
==External links== *[http://www.riksteatern.se/ Riksteatern.se] (official site, in Swedish only)

{{coord|44.110119|N|27.270892|E|type:landmark_region:BG|display=title}} [[File:Roman Tomb Silistra TB.JPG|thumb|Exterior view of the Roman Tomb of Silistra]] The '''Roman Tomb of Silistra''' ({{lang-bg|Римска гробница в Силистра}}, ''Rimska grobnitsa v Silistra'') is an [[Roman funerary practices|Ancient Roman burial tomb]] in the town of [[Silistra]] in northeastern [[Bulgaria]]. Dating to the mid-4th century AD, the Roman Tomb is the best-preserved architectural monument of the [[Roman Empire|Ancient Roman]] city of Durostorum. The tomb is considered "one of the most investigated and most discussed monuments of the late antique art in Bulgaria" and the [[Balkans]],<ref name="atanasov447">Atanasov, p. 447.</ref> owing in large part to the quality and extent of its interior frescoes.
==History== Though the influence of Christianity had reached Silistra by the time, the Roman Tomb is clearly an example of pagan art commissioned by a pagan owner. Thus, it is considered likely that it predates [[Theodosius I]]'s persecution of [[Roman paganism]]. Its construction also likely preceded the [[Goths|Gothic]] invasion of Durostorum of 376–378, which caused great turmoil in the city. The invasion may have caused the master's family depicted in the tomb to flee the city, explaining the lack of burials in the tomb.<ref>Atanasov, p. 451.</ref> In any case, the tomb must be stylistically ascribed to the 4th century and specifically to Theodosius I's reign.<ref name="henning">{{cite book|last=Henning|first=Joachim|title=Post-Roman Towns, Trade and Settlement in Europe and Byzantium: Byzantium, Pliska, and the Balkans|publisher=Walter de Gruyter|date=2007|isbn=3110183579|pages=84–85}}</ref>
The Roman Tomb was coincidentally discovered in 1942 in the southern outskirts of Silistra, a major town in [[Southern Dobruja]] on the banks of the Lower [[Danube]]. Silistra had only recently been transferred by [[Romania]] back to Bulgaria as part of the 1940 [[Treaty of Craiova]]. Since 1984, the Roman Tomb of Silistra has been on [[UNESCO]]'s Tentative List of [[World Heritage Site]]s.<ref name="unesco">{{cite web|url=http://whc.unesco.org/en/tentativelists/48/|title=The late ancient tomb of Silistra|publisher=UNESCO|accessdate=23 January 2016}}</ref>
==Architecture and frescoes== [[File:Roman Tomb Silistra fresco servant.jpg|thumb|A fresco portraying a female servant carrying gifts to the master's family]] The stone tomb features a single [[burial chamber]] and measures {{convert|3.30|by|2.60|m|ft|abbr=off|lk=on}}. It has a west-east orientation, with the entrance on the east wall and a semi-cylindrical brick vault.<ref name="atanasov448">Atanasov, p. 448.</ref> It is located amidst the ruins of a [[necropolis]] from [[Late Antiquity]] which included other similar structures.<ref name="henning"/>
Ceramic plates, rectangular in shape and painted using the [[fresco-secco]] technique, cover the entirety of its floor. In contrast to most other known Roman tombs from the period in the Balkans, the entire interior is covered by multi-coloured mural paintings. The northern, southern and eastern walls feature a procession of [[Slavery in ancient Rome|servants]],<ref name="atanasov448"/> whereas the frescoes of the western wall, directly opposite the entrances, depict the master and his wife.<ref>Atanasov, p. 449.</ref>
A [[frieze]] running along the walls of the tomb contains 11 panels featuring the portraits of male and female slaves bringing various gifts and garments to the masters.<ref name="henning"/><ref name="unesco"/> The procession runs from either side of the central panel that portrays the masters, providing for a symmetrical composition. The tomb's decoration also includes hunting scenes, candlesticks, plants and animals, including [[peacock]]s and [[pigeon]]s.<ref name="henning"/> Overall, the decoration's remarkable level of preservation and the quality of the mural paintings makes the tomb a "unique example of art and life" in the outer regions of the Roman Empire during the turbulent 4th century.<ref name="unesco"/>
The Roman Tomb of Silistra is situated at the intersection of the Sedmi Septemvri and Boyka Voyvoda Streets in the town. As of 2016, it can only be toured after a prior reservation at the Regional Historical Museum of Silistra.<ref name="rim-silistra">{{cite web|url=http://museumsilistra.com/index.php/2-uncategorised/49-rimska-grobnitza|title=Римска гробница|publisher=Регионален исторически музей|language=Bulgarian|accessdate=23 January 2016}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
*{{cite journal|last=Atanasov|first=Georgi|date=2009|title=Late antique tomb in Durostorum‐Silistra and its master|journal=Revista Pontica|publisher=National Museum of History and Archaeology|location=Constanţa|volume=40|issn=1013-4247|url=https://revistapontica.files.wordpress.com/2009/06/pontica-40-pag-447-468.pdf|accessdate=23 January 2016}}

{{Orphan|date=May 2011}}
The term '''telematic performance''' refers to a live performance (art, dance, music, etc.) which makes use of [[telecommunications]] and [[information technology]] to distribute the performers between two or more locations.
While this may involve use of conventional [[videoconferencing]] technology, it has more recently come to mean the use of internet technologies. Performance groups my also refer to their events as ''internet concerts'', ''online jamming'', or ''teleconcerts''.
==History== On June 21, 1982, The first International Summer Solstice Radio Broadcast. Created by Charlie Morrow. Produced by New Wilderness Foundation and WNYC FM. Celebrating the first day of summer (and winter below the equator) with a satellite mix of live events in Sweden, the USA, New Zealand, Canada, Denmark, and Italy. The solstice jam in real time concluded the show.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1982/06/22/arts/druids-mark-solstice-euphoniously.html |title='DRUIDS' MARK SOLSTICE EUPHONIOUSLY |last1=Rockwell |first1=John |last2= |first2= |date=22 June 1982 |website= |publisher=[[The New York Times]] |access-date= |quote=}}</ref>
On August 26, 2012, a ghostpianist concert has been realized in Berlin Philharmonie. Italian pianist Roberto Prosseda played Chopin's Grande Polonaise Brillante op. 22 on a Yamaha Clavinova digital piano in the backstage of the hall, sending the midi signal in real time to the robot-pianist Teo Tronico, which acted as a mirrorpianist, mirroring Prosseda's performance on the Steinway grand piano on stage with Berliner Symphoniker conducted by Michelangelo Galeati.
==Issues== Performers and researchers work to overcome the following obstacles:
# '''Audio latency:''' Most musicians who play in a group rely on audio cues to maintain tempo and other communication. The most obvious example is the use of a drummer in pop music to keep time. In a normal rehearsal or performance environment, there is a delay between the time one musician plays and another hears the sound due to the speed of sound in air. This is typically from 3 - 50ms. When audio is transmitted through a digital medium (i.e. the Internet), the delay (or [[Latency (audio)|latency]]) can be much longer. Cell phones have latency of approximately 50ms. Applications such as Skype have approximately 100ms. And, QuickTime and Windows Media server-based streaming systems add 8 or more seconds of latency. When the latency is too high, the audio cues are no longer effective. Researchers<ref name='lester_boley'>{{cite journal | author=Lester, M, & Boley, J. | title=The Effects of Latency on Live Sound Monitoring | journal=Audio Engineering Society | year=2007 }}{{Full|date=April 2014}}<!--volume number, inclusive pages, and the specific page reference for this citation are needed.--></ref> have shown that some musicians can ignore this delay while others find it obtrusive. In general, the higher the audio quality and the more channels transmitted, the higher the latency needs to be to reliably transmit the audio stream. # '''Echo cancellation:''' Since the latency between locations is much higher than the speed of sound, standard techniques to eliminate feedback from monitoring systems, such as [equalization], do not work. However, when the latency between locations is low enough, teleconferencing [[echo cancellation]] techniques can be used. # '''Video latency:''' Musicians also rely on visual cues to maintain synchronization. The most obvious example is the use of a conductor with orchestral music. Due to the size of video data, latency tends to higher for video than audio latency. # '''Audio/video synchronization:''' In order to maintain audio and video synchronization, audio may be delayed more than necessary. Some performers opt to sacrifice AV synchronization for lower audio latency. For example, those involved with [[improvised]], musical telematic performances may require low latency audio cues.
==Technology==
===Open source=== * [[JACK Audio Connection Kit|Netjack]]
===Commercial software=== * [[Skype]] * [[iChat]]
==Performance groups== * [[Concordia Laptop Orchestra|CLOrk at Concordia]]

{{Infobox artwork | title = The Floating Piers | image_file = Iseo Floating Piers 7.jpg | image_size = | alt = | other_language_1 = | other_title_1 = | type = [[Site-specific art]] | artist = [[Christo and Jeanne-Claude]] | completion_date = {{start date|2016|07|03|df=y}} | condition = Dismantled | city = [[Sulzano]] and [[Monte Isola]], [[Brescia]], [[Lombardy]] | museum = | coordinates = {{coord|45.696059|N|10.096747|E|scale:5000|display=title|format=dms}}<!-- Only use for the exact coordinates of the artwork itself (and only where known) and not for the coordinates of the museum. Leave blank if coordinates are not known. --> | owner = | accession = | url = [http://www.thefloatingpiers.com/#introduction www.thefloatingpiers.com] }}
'''''The Floating Piers''''' was a [[Site-specific art|site-specific]] work of art by [[Christo and Jeanne-Claude]], consisting of 70,000 square meters of yellow fabric, carried by a modular floating dock system of 226,000 high-density polyethylene cubes installed at [[Lake Iseo]] near [[Brescia]], Italy. The fabric created a walkable surface between [[Sulzano]], [[Monte Isola]] and the island of San Paolo.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-36567871|title=Italy: Christo 'walk on water' project opens on Lake Iseo - BBC News|website=BBC News|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
==Origins and development== Christo and Jeanne-Claude began conceptualizing of ''The Floating Piers'' in 1970. Their initial site was [[Rio de la Plata]] between [[Argentina]] and [[Uruguay]]. The couple also considered [[Tokyo Bay]] as a location before moving on to other projects.<ref name="fastcodesign1">{{cite web|author=John Brownlee |url=http://www.fastcodesign.com/3061111/christos-floating-piers-were-50-years-and-17-million-in-the-making |title=Christo's Floating Piers Were 50 Years And $17 Million In The Making | Co.Design | business + design |website=Fastcodesign.com |date=2016-06-21 |accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref>
In late 2013, Christo settled on [[Lake Iseo]] as the location for ''The Floating Piers'' and dedicated the next 22 months to realizing the project. It was the first major project he undertook after the death of his partner and collaborator Jeanne-Claude.
The project was estimated to cost $11 million, but was later reported at closer to $17 million.<ref name="fastcodesign1"/> The funds were raised by Christo himself through sales of his project sketches and original art. Permits took less than a year.
The physical installation of the piers was handled by Deep Dive Systems, a company based in Bulgaria. They installed about 220 six-ton anchors in the lake floor at depths of up to 92 meters, over a period of three months. 226,000 cubes were then attached to those anchors, and covered by 70,000 sq. meters of nylon fabric.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=bg&tl=en&js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.interview.to%2F%25D0%25B1%25D0%25B3%2F%25D0%25B0%25D1%2580%25D1%2585%25D0%25B8%25D0%25B2%2F2017%2Fmarch%2F%25D0%25B8%25D0%25BD%25D0%25B0-%25D0%25B8-%25D1%2580%25D0%25BE%25D1%2581%25D0%25B5%25D0%25BD%2F&edit-text=&act=url | title = Ina i Rosen | author = Diana Aleksieva | work = InterViewTo | date = March 2017 | accessdate = 2017-03-31 | language = Bulgarian | trans-title= Ina and Rosen - Invisible to the eye }}</ref> Over 600 workers were involved in the installation.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/25/arts/design/art-that-lets-you-walk-on-water.html|title= Art That Lets You Walk on Water|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> Traffic planning required a 175-page document and cost €100,000 to produce.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/inside-story-christo-floating-piers-180959072/?no-ist |title=The Inside Story of Christo's Floating Piers | Arts & Culture | Smithsonian |website=Smithsonianmag.com |date= |accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref>
==Opening== [[File:Floating Piers – San Paolo.jpg|thumb|View from Monte Isola]] On June 18, 2016, the saffron-colored walkway opened to the public. 270,000 people visited the free installation in its first five days. Due to the unexpectedly large crowds, organizers began closing the installation from midnight to 6 a.m. each day to allow for cleaning.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/27/travel/floating-piers-lake-iseo-italy/ | title = Floating art lets people walk on water at Italy's Lake Iseo | work = CNN.com | author = Sophie Morlin-Yron | date = 2016-06-27 | accessdate = 2016-06-29 }}</ref> On June 22, the large crowds caused some chaos at the [[Brescia railway station|main train station]] in nearby [[Brescia]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Chaos at Italian lake as crowds try to 'walk on water'|url=http://www.thelocal.it/20160622/chaos-at-italian-lake-as-thousands-try-to-walk-on-water|agency=The Local|date=22 June 2016|ref=chaos}}</ref>
== Closing ==
On July 3, 2016, the work closed to the public; local officials estimated that it had attracted 1.2 million visitors, or an average of 72,000 per day, over its 16-day run. Police estimates were even higher, at 100,000 visitors per day. Dismantling of the project began in the early morning of July 4, 2016.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.dw.com/en/christos-floating-piers-closed/a-19376103 | title = Christo's floating piers closed | work = Deutsche Welle | date = 2016-07-04 | accessdate = 2016-07-04 }}</ref>

{{more footnotes|date=August 2011}} '''The New York Intellectuals''' were a group of American writers and literary critics based in [[New York City]] in the mid-20th century. Mostly Jewish, they advocated [[left-wing politics]] but were also firmly [[anti-Stalinist left|anti-Stalinist]]. The group is known for having sought to integrate [[literary theory]] with [[Marxism]] and [[Socialism]] while rejecting Soviet [[Communism]] as a workable or acceptable political model.
[[Trotskyism]] emerged as the most chosen standpoint among these anti-Stalinist Marxists. [[Irving Howe]], [[Seymour Martin Lipset]], [[Leslie Fiedler]] and [[Nathan Glazer]] were members of the Trotskyist [[Young People's Socialist League]].<ref>Alexander Bloom: Prodigal Sons. The New York Intellectuals and Their World, Oxford University Press: NY / Oxford 1986, p. 109.</ref>
==Overview== Writers often identified as members of this group include [[Hannah Arendt]], [[William Barrett (philosopher)|William Barrett]], [[Daniel Bell]], [[Saul Bellow]], [[Elliot E. Cohen|Elliot Cohen]], [[Midge Decter]], [[Leslie Fiedler]], [[Nathan Glazer]], [[Clement Greenberg]], [[Paul Goodman (writer)|Paul Goodman]], [[Richard Hofstadter]], [[Sidney Hook]], [[Irving Howe]], [[Alfred Kazin]], [[Irving Kristol]], [[Seymour Martin Lipset]], [[Mary McCarthy (author)|Mary McCarthy]], [[Dwight Macdonald]], [[William Phillips (editor)|William Phillips]], [[Norman Podhoretz]], [[Philip Rahv]], [[Harold Rosenberg]], [[Isaac Rosenfeld]], [[Delmore Schwartz]], [[Susan Sontag]], [[Harvey Swados]], [[Diana Trilling]], [[Lionel Trilling]], and [[Robert Warshow]].
Many of these intellectuals were educated at [[City College of New York]] ("Harvard of the Proletariat"), [[New York University]] and [[Columbia University]] in the 1930s, and associated in the next two decades with the left-wing political journals ''[[Partisan Review]]'' and ''[[Dissent (American magazine)|Dissent]]'', as well as the then-left-wing but later neoconservative-leaning journal ''[[Commentary (magazine)|Commentary]]''. Writer [[Nicholas Lemann]] has described these intellectuals as "the American [[Bloomsbury Group|Bloomsbury]]".
Some, including Kristol, Hook, and Podhoretz, later became key figures in the development of [[Neoconservatism]].
==See also== *[[Frankfurt School]] *[[Trotskyism]] *[[Anti-Stalinist left]]
==References== {{Reflist}} *Bloom, Alexander. ''Prodigal Sons: The New York Intellectuals and Their World'', Oxford University Press, 1986, {{ISBN|0-19-503662-X}} *Cooney, Terry A. ''The Rise of the New York Intellectuals: Partisan Review and Its Circle, 1934-1945'', University of Wisconsin Press, 1986, {{ISBN|0-299-10710-8}} *Dorman, Joseph. ''Arguing the World: The New York Intellectuals in their Own Words''. New York: Free Press, 2000. {{ISBN|0-684-86279-4}}. *Jumonville, Neil. ''Critical Crossings: The New York Intellectuals in Postwar America'', University of California Press, 1991, {{ISBN|0-520-06858-0}} *Laskin, David. ''Partisans: Marriage, Politics, and Betrayal Among the New York Intellectuals'' University of Chicago Press, 2001, {{ISBN|0-226-46893-3}} *{{cite book | last = Wald | first = Alan M. | authorlink = Alan M. Wald | title = The New York Intellectuals: The Rise and Decline of the Anti-Stalinist Left from the 1930s to the 1980s | publisher = University of North Carolina Press | date = 1987 | ISBN = 0-8078-4169-2}}

'''''The Ones Below''''' is a 2015 British [[Thriller film|thriller]] directed by [[David Farr (theatre director)|David Farr]] in his [[list of directorial debuts|feature debut]].<ref name="HWR">{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/below-tiff-review-823574 |title='The Ones Below': TIFF Review |accessdate=3 January 2016 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}}</ref> It was shown in the Panorama section at the [[66th Berlin International Film Festival]] and released on 11 March 2016 in the United Kingdom.<ref name="Panorama1">{{cite web |url=https://www.berlinale.de/en/presse/pressemitteilungen/panorama/pan-presse-detail_29908.html |title=Berlinale 2016: Panorama Celebrates Teddy Award’s 30th Anniversary and Announces First Titles in Programme |accessdate=20 December 2015 |work=[[Berlinale]]}}</ref>
==Plot== Kate ([[Clémence Poésy]]) and Justin ([[Stephen Campbell Moore]]) are expecting their first child. They also have new downstairs neighbors, Jon ([[David Morrissey]]) and Theresa ([[Laura Birn]]), who are also expecting their first baby. Kate and Justin invite Jon and Theresa for dinner so they can get acquainted. During their dinner conversation, it's revealed that Kate and Justin originally didn't want children and were together 10 years before deciding to have a baby, and conceived rather quickly thereafter. Jon and Theresa tell them they struggled for seven years to have a child, and Theresa is visibly upset that Kate got pregnant as quickly as she did while she and Jon had tried for years. Eventually, Theresa, who has been sneaking wine all evening, says she doesn't feel well and gets up to leave. In her rush to get out the door, a tipsy Theresa trips over Kate's cat and falls down the stairs and subsequently loses the baby, whom she was going to name Peter.
When Kate and Justin attempt to console the grieving couple, they end up in a fight with Theresa, who screams that Kate does not deserve "that thing" inside her. A few days later, Kate and Justin receive a note stating that their neighbors have left and will return when they can truly be happy for Kate and Justin's new addition.
Kate gives birth and they name the baby Billy. Not long after Billy is born, Jon and Theresa return, apparently in good spirits. Theresa offers to babysit Billy so Kate can have time to herself. When Kate goes off to visit her dead brother's grave, Theresa leaves the house with Billy, but where she takes him isn't revealed. Periodically, Theresa and Jon are shown out and about with Billy. They’re smiling and look like any happy couple with a new baby.
Kate and Justin go to Jon and Theresa's apartment for dinner. Kate brings the [[baby monitor]], through which she hears breathing. She rushes upstairs to find the bathtub overflowing. Over the next few days, Kate grows increasingly suspicious about the other couple's behavior. Kate leaves Billy with Theresa and then goes back to her apartment to spy on her. She sees Theresa take pictures of Billy and put him to her breast, apparently in an attempt to nurse him. Appalled, Kate breaks into Theresa's apartment and finds the camera with photos of Billy and photos of Jon and Theresa in public with Billy. She also discovers a fully furnished nursery complete with a framed photo of Jon and Theresa holding a baby, presumably Billy. Kate later drags Justin into the couple's apartment only to find that the photos have been wiped from the camera and the picture in the nursery has been changed.
Kate, now on the verge of a complete breakdown, asks Justin to move to a new flat. They find a new place, and he works from home until moving day. This plan is cut short when he's called to work for an emergency. He hands Kate the milk, which she's often seen drinking, as he's leaving and tells her to call the moving van for tomorrow. When Justin reaches the office, he discovers there is no urgent meeting. He then receives an email from Kate stating she's "sorry". He rushes home to find Kate drowned in the bath, apparently having killed herself after tossing the baby into a nearby pond. Heartbroken, Justin moves out, as do Jon and Theresa.
The flashback that follows reveals what really happened: Theresa and Jon drugged Kate via the milk from the bottle Justin handed to her on the way out the door; Jon sent Kate's "sorry" email to Justin from her laptop; and Theresa, dressed in Kate's clothing, threw a bundle resembling a swaddled baby into the pond. It's later intimated that the bundle was Kate and Justin's cat.
The final scene shows Jon and Theresa in their new home in [[Germany]], where they're settling with their baby, "Peter".
==Production== The production partly shot at the [[Port of Dover]] ferry terminal in [[Kent]]. <ref>{{cite web |author=Kent Film Office |url=https://kentfilmoffice.co.uk/2016/02/the-ones-below-2016/ |title=Kent Film Office The Ones Below Article}}</ref>
==Cast== * [[Clémence Poésy]] as Kate * [[David Morrissey]] as Jon * [[Stephen Campbell Moore]] as Justin * [[Laura Birn]] as Theresa * [[Deborah Findlay]] as Tessa * [[Jonathan Harden]] as Mark
==Reception== ===Critical response=== On [[review aggregator]] [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film has an approval rating of 72% based on 36 reviews, with an [[average rating]] of 6.2/10.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_ones_below/ |title=''The Ones Below'' (2016) |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |publisher=[[Fandango (company)|Fandango]] |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], the film holds a score of 63 out of 100, based on 13 critics, indicating "generally favorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/the-ones-below |title=''The Ones Below'' Reviews |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=1 April 2018}}</ref>

{{update|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox islands | name = The World Islands (Dubai) | native_name = <!-- or local name to remove the "native name:" prefix --> | sobriquet = <!-- or nickname --> | image_name = Dubaiworld.jpg | image_size = 250px | image_caption = View of The World in early 2009 | image_alt = | map_image = Dubai new developments.png | map_size = 300 | map_caption = | location = [[United Arab Emirates]] | coordinates = {{coord|25|13|00|N|55|10|00|E|display=inline,title}} | archipelago = The World | total_islands = | major_islands = | area_km2 = <!-- or area m2 or area ha --> | area_footnotes = | rank = | length_km = 9 | width_km = 6 | width_footnotes = | coastline_km = <!-- or coastline m --> | coastline_footnotes = | elevation_m = | elevation_footnotes = | highest_mount = <!--name--> | country = [[United Arab Emirates]] | demonym = | population = | population_as_of = | density_km2 = | density_footnotes = | ethnic_groups = | website = {{URL|www.nakheel.com}} | additional_info = '''Developer:''' [[Nakheel]] }} [[File:The world Dubai.jpg|thumb|right|450px|The development's logo]] '''The World''' or '''The World Islands, located in Dubai,''' ([[Arabic language|Arabic]]: جزر العالم; ''Juzur al-Ālam'') is an [[Artificial island|artificial]] [[archipelago]] of various small [[island]]s constructed in the rough shape of a [[world map]], located in the waters of the [[Persian Gulf]], {{Convert|4.0|km|mi}} off the coast of [[Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates]].<ref name="Progress Update">{{cite web|url=http://www.ameinfo.com/133896.html |publisher=''[[AMEInfo]]'' |title=Dubai's Palm and World Islands - progress update |date=2007-10-04 |accessdate=2008-02-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011022845/http://www.ameinfo.com/133896.html |archivedate=2007-10-11 |df= }}</ref> The World islands are composed mainly of sand [[dredging|dredged]] from Dubai's shallow coastal waters, and are one of several [[artificial island]] developments in Dubai.<ref name="Progress Update"/> The World's developer is [[Nakheel Properties]], and the project was originally conceived by [[Sheikh]] [[Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum]], the ruler of Dubai. The actual construction was done by two Dutch (joint venture) specialist companies, Van Oord and Boskalis. The same companies also created the [[Palm Jumeirah]].
Construction of the 300 islands began in 2003, only to halt due to the [[2008 financial crisis]].<ref name="Sinking">{{cite news|title='The World' is sinking|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/travel/international/4594274/The-World-is-sinking|accessdate=28 January 2011|newspaper=The Age|date=28 January 2011}}</ref> Though 60 percent of the islands had been sold off to private contractors back in 2008, development on most of these islands has failed to initiate.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Schaffer|first1=Sierra|title=The "World" Is Sinking Back Into The Sea, Dubai's World Islands That Is – TechMalak|url=https://www.techmalak.com/the-world-is-sinking-back-into-the-sea-dubais-world-that-is/#.WS2awHXyukA|work=TechMalak|date=23 May 2016}}</ref> As of July 2012, the Lebanon Island was developed and was the only island that had so far been developed commercially, being used for private corporate events and public parties. As of late 2013, only two of the islands had been developed. In January 2014, Kleindienst Group announced the launch of "The Heart of Europe" project;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jk-properties.com/newsletters/january2014/ |title= KLEINDIENST GROUP LAUNCHES ICONIC THE HEART OF EUROPE PROJECT|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= January 2014 |publisher= JK Properties |accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> by February 2014, one of Kleindienst Group's brands - JK Properties - announced in their monthly newsletter that the project was "well underway".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.jk-properties.com/newsletters/february2014/ |title= WORK CONTINUES TO PROGRESS AT A PACE ON THE HEART OF EUROPE |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= February 2014 |publisher= JK Properties |accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> The first of these series of islands will be Europe, Sweden and Germany with development led by Kleindienst Group.
==Project== Islands in the project range from {{convert|14000|to|42000|m2|sqft}} in area.<ref name="Progress Update"/> Distances between islands average {{convert|100|m|ft}}; they are constructed from {{convert|321,000,000|m3|abbr=out}} of sand and 386 million tons of rock.<ref name="Progress Update"/> Designed by [[Creative Kingdom Dubai]], the development is an area that covers {{convert|6|by|9|km|mi}} and is surrounded by an oval-shaped [[Breakwater (structure)|breakwater]] island. Roughly {{convert|232|km|abbr=on}} of shoreline was created. The World's overall development costs were estimated at $13 billion [[Canadian Dollar|CAD]] in 2005.
The archipelago consists of seven sets of islands; [[Europe]], [[Africa]], [[Asia]], [[North America]], [[South America]], [[Antarctica]], and [[Oceania]].<ref name="Atlas Obscura 2016">{{cite web | title=The World Islands | website=Atlas Obscura | date=September 26, 2016 | url=http://www.atlasobscura.com/places/world-islands | access-date=July 8, 2018}}</ref> Each artificial islands are named for their representative regions, including those representing [[countries]], [[landmarks]], and [[regions]] such as the [[United Kingdom]],<ref>{{OSM|w|186483481|United Kingdom}} {{coord|25.22334|N|55.15937|E|format=dec|name=United Kingdom}}</ref> [[California]],<ref>{{OSM|r|2713321|California|tools=short}} {{coord|25.20300|N|55.14376|E|format=dec|name=California}}</ref> [[Mount Everest]],<ref>{{OSM|w|87185503|Mount Everest}} {{coord|25.23683|N|55.17535|E|format=dec|name=Mount Everest}}</ref> [[Australia]],<ref>{{OSM|w|87185938|Australia}} {{coord|25.23149|N|55.19435|E|format=dec|name=Australia}}</ref> [[New Mexico]],<ref>{{OSM|r|8402261|New Mexico}} {{coord|25.201379|N|55.151797|E|format=dec|name=New Mexico}}</ref> [[Upernavik]],<ref>{{OSM|w|87184344|Upernavik}} {{coord|25.22142|N|55.13939|E|format=dec|name=Upernavik}}</ref> [[Buenos Aires]],<ref>{{OSM|w|202033673|Buenos Aires}} {{coord|25.20106|N|55.1695|E|format=dec|name=Buenos Aires}}</ref> [[New York (state)|New York]],<ref>{{OSM|w|87184265|New York}} {{coord|25.21421|N|55.15101|E|format=dec|name=New York}}</ref> [[Mexico]],<ref>{{OSM|r|8402263|Mexico}} {{coord|25.201824|N|55.154394|E|format=dec|name=Mexico}}</ref> [[St. Petersburg]]<ref>{{OSM|w|200489433|St. Petersburg}} {{coord|25.23475|N|55.16479|E|format=dec|name=St. Petersburg}}</ref> and [[India]].<ref>{{OSM|w|170773643|India}} {{coord|25.23110|N|55.1796|E|format=dec|name=India}}</ref>
==History== The project was unveiled in May 2003 by Sheikh Mohammed<ref name="AB">{{cite web |url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/507983-the-world-islands-in-dubai-completed |publisher=''ArabianBusiness.com'' |title=The World islands in Dubai complete |date=2008-01-10 |accessdate=2008-02-02}}</ref> and dredging began four months later in September 2003.<ref name="AB"/> By January 2008, 60% of the islands were sold, 20 of which were bought in the first four months of 2007.<ref name="Progress Update"/><ref name="AB"/> On 10 January 2008 the final stone on the breakwater was laid, completing development of the archipelago.<ref name="AB"/> As of July 2012, a second island, the Lebanon Island was developed and was 'the only island that has so far been developed commercially, is used for private corporate events and public parties.' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/uae-news/the-world-is-back-on-dubais-map|title=The World is back on Dubai's map|author=Colin Simpson|publisher=|accessdate=18 April 2016}}</ref>
==Project difficulties== [[The Times]] Online reported in September 2009 that work on The World had been suspended due to the effects of the [[Financial crisis of 2007–2010|global financial crisis]].<ref name="creditcrunch">{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/travel/news/article6831481.ece|title=Credit crunch signals end of The World for Dubai’s multi-billion dollar property deal|publisher=Times Online UK|date=September 12, 2009|accessdate=2009-11-28 | location=London | first=James | last=McLean}}</ref><ref name="darkside">{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/opinion/commentators/johann-hari/the-dark-side-of-dubai-1664368.html |title=The dark side of Dubai |author=Johann Hari |publisher=The Independent |date=2009-04-07 |accessdate=2009-05-16 | location=London }}</ref> And in February 2010 the [[Daily Mail]] reported that the islands had started sinking back into the sea.<ref name=Bates>{{Citation | title = Is it the end of the world? Nasa picture suggests Dubai globe is sinking back into the sea | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-1247651/World-Islands-Is-end-world-Nasa-picture-suggests-Dubai-globe-sinking-sea.html | author = Bates, Claire | journal = Daily Mail | accessdate = 2010-04-07 | date=2010-02-02 | location=London }}</ref> This was later denied by Nakheel and independent technical reports as wholly inaccurate.<ref name="McGinley">{{cite web |url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/580782-island-owners-hit-back-at-sinking-claims |title=Island owners hit back at 'sinking' claims |author= Shane McGinley |publisher=arabianbusiness |date=2010-02-04 |accessdate=2010-02-04 }}</ref> Despite the denial, [[The Daily Telegraph]] reported in January 2011 that an independent company, Penguin Marine, provided verification on the erosion of the islands and the silting of the passageways between the islands.<ref name=Penguin>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/dubai/8271643/The-World-is-sinking-Dubai-islands-falling-into-the-sea.html |title=The World is sinking: Dubai islands 'falling into the sea' |publisher = The Daily Telegraph |date=2011-01-20 |accessdate=2011-01-25 |location=London |first=Richard |last=Spencer}}</ref> Due to finance and technical problems, Penguin Marine, the company contracted to provide transportation to the archipelago, is attempting to get out of the annual fees of $1.6 million paid to Nakheel properties.<ref name =Penguin/>
As of early 2011, only one of the islands had been occupied by a building (a show home) on it,<ref name=Sinking/> and commercial or residential properties were not currently being constructed on any of the other islands. Property prices in the Emirates had fallen 58 percent from their peak in the fourth quarter of 2008.<ref>{{cite web|title=The End of The World|url=http://english.kompas.com/read/2011/01/23/03401537/The.End.of.The.World|work=Kompas.com|accessdate=6 January 2012}}</ref> The world economic recovery from the [[Great Recession]] has resulted in a rebound for the Dubai real estate market: it has been reported that "residential prices [in Dubai] rose by 17.9% from August 2012 to 2013, while rents soared by 14.9% in the same period." <ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.jk-properties.com/newsletters/november2013/|title=JK Properties Monthly Newsletter (Nov. 2013) "A BRIGHT OUTLOOK FOR DUBAI’S PROPERTY MARKET" |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=November 2013 |publisher=JK Properties |accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref>
Irish investor/businessman John O'Dolan, who purchased the "Ireland" island, committed suicide in February 2009, after his consortium fell into financial difficulty.<ref>{{Citation | title = Extravagant Dubai island project sinks under weight of the credit crunch | url = http://www.independent.ie/world-news/middle-east/extravagant-dubai-island-project-sinks-under-weight-of-the-credit-crunch-1884856.html | date = September 12, 2009 | journal = Irish Independent | last1 = McLean | first1 = James | last2 = McDonald | first2 = Brian | accessdate = 2010-04-07 }}</ref>
==Purchase and development plans== [[File:2010 The World.JPG|thumb|The World 2010 (airview)]]
The World was supposed to be serviced by four major transportation hubs linked by waterways. Land parcels are supposedly zoned for various uses: estate, mid density, high density, resorts and commercial.<ref name="video">{{cite web|url=http://www.theworld.ae/videoGallery.html | title=The World Video Gallery|author=Nakheel}}</ref> A Dubai Infinity Holdings construction planner has stated that developers have been negotiating with Nakheel about temporary siting of a cement batching plant on one of the islands to supply subdivided construction.<ref name="national3quarters">{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/property/the-world-three-quarters-sold-out|title=‘The World’ three-quarters sold out|author=The National Newspaper}}</ref>
The plan was for utilities to be routed under water, with water plants at each of the hubs pumping fresh water to the islands. Power was to be supplied by the Dubai Grid and distributed through underwater cables, however as of February 2015 no cables had been laid, so that developers currently have to provide their own power from diesel generators. Waste water and refuse systems are an individual concern for each island.<ref name="video"/>
Nakheel Group is itself further developing a resort named Coral Island over 20 islands that make up the North American part of The World. The low-rise development will include a marina and hotel village.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uaeinteract.com/docs/Nakheel_unveils_super-luxury_resort_at_Coral_Island_of_The_World/25125.htm|title=Nakheel unveils super-luxury resort at Coral Island of The World |date=2007-03-05|publisher=National Media Council UAE|accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> The second largest confirmed development is the purchase of 14 islands that make up Australia and New Zealand by Investment Dar of [[Kuwait]]. The islands are being [[terraforming|terraformed]] to be developed as a resort named [[OQYANA]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asiatraveltips.com/news05/134-TheWorld.shtml|title=Nakheel sells Australasia segment of The World|date=2005-04-13|publisher=AsiaTravelTips.com|accessdate=2006-12-29}}</ref>
Irish business consortium Larionovo had plans to develop the [[Ireland]] island into an Irish-themed resort.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theislandofireland.com/|title=The Island of Ireland|accessdate=2007-07-23}}</ref> The plans include a large internal marina, apartments and villas, a gym, hotel, and an Irish-themed pub. In July 2007 it was announced that the Ireland Island would feature a recreation of [[Northern Ireland]]'s [[Giant's Causeway]]. However, on 25 November 2008 a provisional liquidator was appointed to Larionovo.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.larionovo.com/ |title=Larionovo }}</ref> The islands of [[Great Britain]] and [[Moscow]] on The World were acquired by Premier Real Estate Bureau in the Summer of 2008. News was leaked in a [[Daily Mail]] article of January 2009, refuting claims that Great Britain was owned by [[Richard Branson]], [[Rod Stewart]] or John O'Dolan.<ref>{{cite news |title=Homesick Balham boy buys Britain-shaped island for £43m |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1120695/Homesick-Balham-boy-buys-Britain-shaped-island-43m--8211-London-pub.html |publisher=Daily Mail|accessdate=2009-04-08 | first=Martin | last=Delgado | date=2009-01-17}}</ref>
In April 2008, Salya Corporation announced that it had acquired the islands of Finland and Brunei in The World and planned to develop them into fashion-themed resorts. Salya spent about [[United Arab Emirates dirham|Dh]]800 million ($218 million USD) to purchase the islands and plans to spend a further Dh2.4 billion ($654 million USD) on development. Brunei Island will be turned into a [[Fashion TV]] resort and Finland Island will be turned into a fashion community called FTV palace.<ref>{{cite web |title=World's Finland and Brunei to be hub of fashion |url=http://www.business24-7.ae/articles/2008/4/pages/worldhub.aspx |publisher=Emirates Business 24/7 |date=2008-04-24 |accessdate=2008-04-27}}</ref>
Safi Qurashi, the seven-time multi-millionaire entrepreneur <ref>Leftly, Mark. ''Anger over pay is just the free market in action'', [[The Independent]] 10 June 2012</ref> at the head of Premier, and his business partner Mustafa Nagri, paid an estimated $64 million USD for the {{convert|11|acre|ha|adj=on|order=flip}} piece of land; he was later convicted for non-payment of cheques and sentenced to seven years in jail.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/jul/23/dubai-safi-qurashi | location=London | work=The Guardian | first=Rajeev | last=Syal | title=Owner of Dubai's 'little Britain' jailed for non-payment of cheques | date=2010-07-23}}</ref> However, on appeal he was later found not guilty and released from prison in July 2012 when he was declared innocent of two of the three charges.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/exclusive-two-safi-qurashi-judgements-quashed-466985.html | location=Dubai | work=Arabian Business | first=Shane | last=McGinley | title=EXCLUSIVE: Two Safi Qurashi judgements quashed | date=2012-07-23}}</ref> and <ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/personalfinance/expat-money/9423555/Briton-Safi-Qurashi-has-convictions-overturned-in-Dubai.html | location=London | work=The Telegraph | first=Leah | last=Hyslop | title=Briton Safi Qurashi has convictions overturned in Dubai | date=2012-07-24}}</ref> On the final charges the civil court final judgment showed he owed no money, was a victim of fraud and vindicated him completely by awarding 10.8 Million USD to be paid back to him by his former partner who had defrauded him.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/dubai-s-safi-qurashi-cleared-of-bouncing-2-7m-cheque-489328.html | location=Dubai | work=Arabian Business | first=Claire | last=Valdini | title=Dubai's Safi Qurashi cleared of bouncing $2.7m cheque | date=2013-02-13}}</ref> and <ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.arabianbusiness.com/safi-qurashi-s-former-partner-ordered-repay-10-8m-by-dubai-court-529323.html | location=Dubai | work=Arabian Business | first=Ashford | last=Fernandez | title=Safi Qurashi’s former partner ordered to repay $10.8m by Dubai court | date=2013-12-04}}</ref> Safi Qurashi is still the owner of GB Island and continues to live and run his businesses in Dubai and is still confident of developing the Island of GB into a unique destination.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.constructionweekonline.com/article-32193-interview-not-the-end-of-the-world-safi-qurashi/ | location=Dubai | work=Construction Week | first=Hannah | last=Raven | title=Interview: Not the End of the World, Safi Qurashi | date=2015-01-17}}</ref>
Josef Kleindienst and his firm JK Properties are developing The Heart of Europe, a collection of seven islands (Germany, Netherlands, Sweden, St. Petersburg, Main Europe, Switzerland and Monaco) in the European section of the World, into an island luxury resort.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Heart of Europe|url=http://www.thoe.com/|accessdate=14 February 2016}}</ref> The resort is meant to create a fully immersive European experience, with outdoor snow,<ref>{{cite news|title=Heart of Europe in Dubai: Streets with snow|url=http://www.emirates247.com/property/heart-of-europe-in-dubai-streets-with-snow-2014-01-20-1.535342|accessdate=14 February 2016|publisher=Emirates 24/7|date=20 January 2014}}</ref> and stores accepting only the EURO as a currency.<ref>{{cite news|title=VIDEO: Plans to make it snow in Dubai are not a gimmick, says CEO|url=http://7days.ae/plans-make-snow-dubai-not-gimmick-says-ceo|accessdate=14 February 2016|publisher=7Days}}</ref>
==Timeline of construction== {{See also|List of Developments on The World Islands}} [[File:The World on 1 May 2007 Pict 4.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Undeveloped islands on 1 May 2007]]
[[File:The World Archipelago April 2015.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Undeveloped islands on 11 April 2015]]
*May 2003: The World development was announced by Nakheel, total completion scheduled for 2008. It was initially to have 200 islands and an area of {{convert|60000000|sqft|m2|order=flip}}.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com">{{cite web|author=Dubai FAQs |url=http://www.dubaifaqs.com/the-world-dubai.php |title=The World Dubai |publisher=Dubaifaqs.com |date= |accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref> *February 2004: It was announced that The World would comprise 260 islands, and its area would be 6 km by 9 km, with an area of {{convert|250|-|900000|sqft|m2|order=flip}} for each island, with {{convert|50|-|100|m|ft|abbr=on}} of water between each island.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *August 2004: It was announced that land reclamation would cost at AED 7.3 billion ($2 billion).<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *April 2005: Sand dredging 55 percent complete, 88 islands had been completed.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *30 March 2006: [[Richard Branson]] appeared at a media conference on the [[Great Britain]] island. However, this was to announce direct [[London]]-to-[[Dubai]] flights by [[Virgin Atlantic]], and was not related to his investing in the project.<ref>{{cite web|author=smh |url=http://www.asiatraveltips.com/news06/303-TheWorld.shtml |title=Sir Richard Branson 'Stakes his Claim' on The World in Dubai |publisher=Asiatraveltips.com |date=2006-03-30 |accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref> *October 2006: Seven-time [[Formula One]] World Champion [[Michael Schumacher]] was presented with one of the islands by Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum on the occasion of his final [[Grand Prix motor racing|Grand Prix]], in Brazil. Schumacher's manager [[Willi Weber]], suggested, "Perhaps he'll build a [[kart racing]] track on [the island].<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *December 2006: The World reclamation 90 percent complete.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *October 2007: Nakheel announced the sale of Ireland, and Shanghai in October 2007.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *15 November 2007: [[Brad Pitt]] and [[Angelina Jolie]] were reported to have purchased the island ''Ethiopia''{{according to whom|date=December 2015}}. The claim has since been refuted.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jacobs|first1=Frank|title=The World (Under Construction)|url=http://bigthink.com/strange-maps/the-world-under-construction|website=BigThink|publisher=The Big Think, Inc.|accessdate=22 December 2015|date=2014-10-30}}</ref> *January 2008: The World breakwater is completed.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *19 February 2008: Cinnovation Group acquired a {{convert|37000|m2|sqft|adj=on}} island as part of a project valued at $200 million USD. Guest and residential villas and a hospitality complex are planned.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.europe-re.com/system/main.php?pageid=2343&articleid=10631 |title=Cinnovation acquires Nova Island on The World (UAE/SG) |publisher=Europe-re.com |date=2010-06-01 |accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref> [[File:Artificial Archipelagos, Dubai, United Arab Emirates ISS022-E-024940 lrg.jpg|thumb|left|Artificial archipelagos, [[Dubai]], United Arab Emirates]] *25 February 2008: Dubai Multi Commodities Centre announced that it will establish a {{convert|6000|m2|sqft|adj=on}} [[pearl hunting|pearling]] and marine entertainment center in association with Paspaley Pearling Corporation. It will be located on an island in the Antarctic region of The World.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ameinfo.com/148011.html |title=Dubai unveils 'Pearls of Arabia' at The World | DMCC |publisher=AMEinfo.com |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref> *September 2008: Dubai's Limitless announced plans to develop a $161 million USD wellness resort on an island in "Siberia". Pearl Dubai paid $27.2 million USD for a {{convert|1600000|sqft|m2|adj=on|order=flip}} island nearby.<ref name="thenational.ae"/> *28 December 2008: Turkey Island was bought by MNG Holding in June 2008 for $19 million USD.<ref name="thenational.ae">{{cite web|author=- Saturday |url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/property/the-world-three-quarters-sold-out |title='The World' three-quarters sold out - The National |publisher=Thenational.ae |date=2012-06-06 |accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref> *28 December 2008: China's Zhongzhou International announced that it will be developing a hotel resort on Shanghai island.<ref name="thenational.ae"/> *28 December 2008: Nakheel said 70 percent of The World had been sold.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *October 2009: An Emirates Business report on 13 October 2009 that 2 islands were sold in July and August 2009.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *December 2009: Dubai based Kleindienst Group said they would start construction of the Heart of Europe in early 2010, according to a press report of 17 December 2009. Islands include Austria, Germany, Netherlands, St Petersburg, Sweden and Switzerland.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *January 2010: On 28 January 2010 Emirates Business reported that Major Trade had started development of their projects on an island in the Greenland area, a villa and hotel resort.<ref name="dubaifaqs.com"/> *23 February 2010: Dubai-based Kleindienst Group started work on the Germany island of The World, according to a press release on 24 February 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ameinfo.com/225097.html |title=First developer breaks ground on The World | Real Estate |publisher=AMEinfo.com |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2012-07-07}}</ref> [[File:The World islands map.svg|thumb|300px|The World islands map, annotated with existing developments]] *17 July 2012: The Royal Island Beach Club opened on Lebanon Island. *6 May 2013: Nakheel announces that an out of court settlement has been reached between itself and developer Kleindienst Group, allowing construction on "The Heart of Europe" to resume.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nakheel.com/en/media/news/the-world-llc-settles-with-kleindienst-properties |title=The World LLC settles with Kleindienst Properties |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=6 May 2013 |publisher= Nakheel PJSC |accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> *10 June 2013: Construction began on the island Taiwan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emirates247.com/news/emirates/dubai-s-the-world-construction-on-taiwan-begins-post-ramadan-2013-06-10-1.509715|title=Dubai's The World: Construction on Taiwan begins post-Ramadan|author=System Administrator|work=Emirates 24-7|accessdate=18 April 2016}}</ref> *2 July 2013: Nakheel announces that settlements "with São Paulo Development Ltd for São Paulo Island and a GCC investor for the purchase of Nord Island", totaling "AED185 million", along with the earlier out of court settlement with Kleindienst Group (valued at AED622 million) have "put The World back on the map".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nakheel.com/en/media/news/settlements-worth-aed807-million-put-the-world-back-on-the-map |title= Settlements worth AED807 million put The World back on the map |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 2 July 2013 |publisher= Nakheel PJSC|accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> *10 December 2013: Nakheel announced plans to connect the islands with a road.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.constructionweekonline.com/article-25515-road-could-be-built-to-man-made-world-development/#.UsrFm2SzAa4|title=Road could be built to man-made World development|publisher=|accessdate=18 April 2016}}</ref> *January 2014: Kleindienst Group's JK Properties announces that "[w]ork has commenced on The Heart of Europe".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jk-properties.com/newsletters/january2014/ |title= JK Properties Monthly Newsletter (January 2014), "KLEINDIENST GROUP LAUNCHES ICONIC THE HEART OF EUROPE PROJECT" |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= January 2014 |publisher= JK Properties|accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> *January 2014: Website "The Heart of Europe" publishes monthly construction updates for the project.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.thoe.com/construction-updates|title= The Heart of Europe - Construction Updates|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= January 2014 |publisher= The Heart of Europe|accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> *February 2014: JK Properties announces that the "Heart of Europe" islands construction is "well underway".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jk-properties.com/newsletters/february2014/ |title= JK Properties Newsletter (February 2014), "The Construction of the Heart of Europe Islands is Now Well Underway"|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= February 2014 |publisher= JK Properties |accessdate=14 March 2014}}</ref> *7 December 2016: The Heart of Europe project makes major progress when the Dubai-based company JK Bauen, part of the Kleindienst Group, appointed Chinese-based companies Wuchang Ship Building Industry Group and Sino Great Wall International Engineering in a joint venture to develop facilities on the six islands.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fahy|first1=Michael|title=Heart of Europe development at The World Islands off Dubai coast takes major step forward {{!}} The National|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/property/heart-of-europe-development-at-the-world-islands-off-dubai-coast-takes-major-step-forward|work=The National|date=7 December 2016}}</ref>
